title: Local Worlds Viewing Parties
body:
http://riot-web-cdn.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/lolesports/s3fs-public/styles/article_image/public/worlds_header_800x315_4615.jpg?itok=4bvqKTQh

Hey everyone,

Hopefully you noticed we recently announced that select Hoyts Cinemas will be holding viewing parties for Worlds - http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/worlds-viewingparties/

Auckland, Sydney, Perth, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide each have a Hoyts Cinema Viewing party. (Above link for more info)

BUT Don't forget there are also a bunch of other Community Viewing parties happening for Worlds. A good place to check is our events page under the Worlds viewing parties tab - http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/events/upcoming?type=viewing-party&tags=worlds-2015&language=en

Below is a list of Community Viewing Parties if you can't make it to the Hoyts Cinema

**Australia**

Brisbane

* LoL: World Championship Finals - Brisbane 2015 - https://www.facebook.com/events/1664000963813506/ 
* 2015 Brisbane Bar Event: LoL World's Final Screening -https://www.facebook.com/events/1629270504020888/ 

Melbourne

* Ministry of Gaming - https://www.facebook.com/events/687166011419290/
* Silicon Sports -  https://www.facebook.com/events/1001035769907992/

Canberra

* ANU PC Gaming - https://www.facebook.com/events/982797085116986/

Perth

* University Computer Club - UCC - https://www.facebook.com/events/895725683840853/

**New Zealand**
Wellington = https://www.facebook.com/events/462476713932620/
Hamilton = https://www.facebook.com/events/991381347580180/
Christchurch = https://www.facebook.com/events/1006735886056966/
Dunedin = https://www.facebook.com/groups/1389690251332401/ 

I will be adding to this list as more come through if your event is here comment below and make sure to register on our events page! http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/

replies.body:
Y not Hoyts Melbourne Central :c
It's better because it's in the middle of the city, unlike Highpoint, how it's in an awkward place for most of us Melbournians
Im curious, i bought tickets for the live viewing in sydney and i just want to know what i could expect in the gift bag, and if the cinema will be stocking any League of legends merch

Hey man,

We haven't specified what's in the Hoyts gift bag yet except that there is a skin code, and it is different from the OPL skin code.

We are currently unable to get merch stocked at the cinemas.

Ok thats all good, this is my first viewing i am going too and am really excited for it and i knew about the skin code and had been searching all around everywhere for a hint about what else could be in the goody bag, but not knowing doesnt phase me, if anything it makes it a little more exciting, its a shame about the merch though but thanks for the fast response

You're going to love it! Watching League of the big screen is an amazing experience, especially to be in a room filled with like-minded fans. It is a shame about the merch, but it wouldn't be be viable in a logistics sense for Riot to send stuff to each cinema. Hey Maraudaur, instead of that though, any chance Hoyts attendees could get a discount at the Riot merch store (if that's even a possibility)?
Yeah i understand that :/ just got over excited on my part, and yeah im sure i will love it, i will be backing SKT want history to be made, first team to win worlds twice

Here is the link for the [facebook event ](https://www.facebook.com/events/1001035769907992/)for the Silicon Sports experience. 

Viewing eSports on the big screen is a pretty fun & comfortable experience. It's also a great way to get involved with the booming eSports community across Melbourne and add some cool people into your social circle!
